oai_dc:dc.dc:title: George H. Hull [amp] Co. in Cincinnati, Ohio to Dayton Coal and Iron Co.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hull, George H., 1840-
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For current rights information, please visit: http://idserver.utk.edu/?id=200600000001200
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A letter from George H. Hull and Company in Cincinnati, Ohio to the Dayton Coal and Iron Company. In the letter, Hull informs Dayton that their two railroad cards have delivered a shipment of mill iron to his company`s yard. Hull writes that the iron is very light-colored and poor quality.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Iron industry and trade.
Railroad cars.
Trade, Business, and Industry.
Transportation and Internal Improvements.
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: The Development of the Industrial United States (1870-1900).
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Hull, George H.; Isaacson, W.J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Digital Collection: The Growth of Democracy in Tennessee: A Grassroots Approach to Volunteer Voices, http://idserver.utk.edu/?id=200600000001199
